complyr 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Data generating process: propensity score

Source: R/dgp_prop_score.R
dgp_prop_score.Rd

Generates the covariates and the propensity scores. The propensity scores are generated by ps = stats::make.link(ps_link)$linkinv(eta_0 + eta_1 * x1 + eta_2 * x2 + eta_3 * x1_t + eta_4 * x2_t).

dgp_prop_score(
  n = 200,
  x1_dist = "normal",
  x2_dist = "normal",
  sigma_x = 1,
  nonlinearity = "sin",
  ps_link = "logit",
  ps_trim = 0.05,
  eta_0 = 0,
  eta_1 = 0,
  eta_2 = 0,
  eta_3 = 0,
  eta_4 = 0
)

Arguments

n

numeric Number of samples (observations).

x1_dist

character "binary", "uniform", "normal".

x2_dist

character "binary", "uniform", "normal".

sigma_x

numeric Standard deviation of x (if not binary).

nonlinearity

character Apply what nonlinear transformation to x?

ps_link

character link function for propensity score DGP, see ?make.link.

ps_trim

numeric This enforces positivity assumption. (ps_trim, 1 - ps_trim) will be the bound of generated propensity score, implemented by rejection sampling.

eta_0

numeric Coefficients for the propensity score DGP.

eta_1

numeric Coefficients for the propensity score DGP.

eta_2

numeric Coefficients for the propensity score DGP.

eta_3

numeric Coefficients for the propensity score DGP.

eta_4

numeric Coefficients for the propensity score DGP.

Value

data.frame
df - generated data frame with columns x1, x2, x2_t, lp, ps, z
df$x1 - "binary" ~ Bernoulli(0.5), "uniform" ~ U(-sqrt(3)sigma_x, sqrt(3)sigma_x), "normal" ~ N(0, sigma_x^2)
df$x2 - "uniform" ~ U(-sqrt(3)sigma_x, sqrt(3)sigma_x), "normal" ~ N(0, sigma_x^2)
df$x1_t - "sin": sin(x1), "inv": sign(x1) / (abs(x1) + 1)
df$x2_t - "sin": sin(x2), "inv": sign(x2) / (abs(x2) + 1)
df$lp - linear part: eta_0 + eta_1 * x1 + eta_2 * x2 + eta_3 * x1_t + eta_4 * x2_t
df$ps = stats::make.link(ps_link)$linkinv(eta_0 + eta_1 * x1 + eta_2 * x2 + eta_3 * x1_t + eta_4 * x2_t)
df$z - randomized treatment assignment based on the propensity scores.

Examples

dgp_prop_score(n = 5)
#>           x1         x2       x1_t       x2_t lp  ps z
#> 1 -1.2979677  0.2303901 -0.9630126  0.2283574  0 0.5 0
#> 2 -2.0848539  1.1310112 -0.8707565  0.9048432  0 0.5 1
#> 3 -0.5253044 -0.7427088 -0.5014764 -0.6762858  0 0.5 1
#> 4  0.1124018  0.8397365  0.1121653  0.7444672  0 0.5 1
#> 5 -0.3344141  0.8126830 -0.3282158  0.7261345  0 0.5 1
